gps.desc: Record a coordinate near the site centre

Boundary_criterion.desc: Select criterion used in recording boundary coordinates

Device_photos.desc: Please take one or more overview shots, and if relevant, additional detailed shots of prominent features. If using a DSLR, enter relevant details below and ensure these are uploaded at days end.

Dominant_vegetation_type.desc: 30m observational unit, uppermost vegetation stratum only

Dominant_vegetation_cover.desc: Vegetation cover, 30 m observational unit, uppermost vegetation stratum only

Additional_environmental_notes.desc: Additional notes about landscape, vegetation, geomorphology of significance and not already captured

Morphology_type.desc: Consider the geomorphological context of the site and select most appropriate response. Use notes below for additional description or if unsure

Morphology_notes.desc: Record any additional notes about site morphology not captured elsewhere

Length_m.desc: Estimate maximum length of feature, using a tape or pacing

Width_m.desc: Estimate maximum width of feature, using tape or pacing

Other_measurement.desc: Record other key measurements here, with annotation to describe what measurement relates to. Please ensure units are noted here

Stone_artefact_count.desc: Record a tally of stone artefacts observed on the site. Use the certainty slider for estimates on large assemblages

Historical_artefact_count.desc: Record a tally of historic artefacts observed on the site. Use the certainty slider for estimates on large assemblages

In_situ_hearth_count.desc: Record a tally of all in situ hearths observed

Heating_element_scatters.desc: Is there evidence of disturbed or remnant hearths as indicated by scatters of heating elements within the feature boundary?

Heating_element_types_observed.desc: Select all heating element types observed

Subsurface_potential.desc: Assess the potential for sub-surface deposits of cultural material.

Additional_notes.desc: Additional notes about the feature or associated artefacts not recorded elsewhere.

Paper_notes_and_sketches.desc: Photograph or otherwise upload any hard copy notes, sketches or plans associated with this feature. Ensure north arrow, approximate scale and a key are included. Use annotation for additional comments.

External_camera_ID.desc: Select other cameras used for photography (if applicable)

External_camera_file_names_and_attachmen.desc: Provide file names and brief captions for images taken with external camera, if applicable.

External_camera_image_attachment.desc: Upload files on server, and annotate those files with captions.

Survey_instrument_name.desc: If recording coincides with instrument survey, please select appropriate instrument name.

Survey_instrument_data.desc: If recording coincides with instrument survey, please detail job name logged to instrument and associated point IDs or range of IDs associated with this feature.

gps.desc: Record boundary coordinates at 3-5 m intervals

Comment.desc: Use this field to document any relevant information about the recorded point

Boundary_criterion.desc: Select criterion used in recording boundary coordinates

Device_photos.desc: Please take one or more overview shots, and if relevant, additional detailed shots of prominent features. If using a DSLR, enter relevant details below and ensure these are uploaded at days end.

Dominant_vegetation_type.desc: 30m observational unit, uppermost vegetation stratum only

Dominant_vegetation_cover.desc: Vegetation cover, 30 m observational unit, uppermost vegetation stratum only

Additional_environmental_notes.desc: Additional notes about landscape, vegetation, geomorphology of significance and not already captured

Morphology_type.desc: Consider the geomorphological context of the site and select most appropriate response. Use notes below for additional description or if unsure

Morphology_notes.desc: Record any additional notes about site morphology not captured elsewhere

Mound_matrix.desc: Select the option that best describes the matrix of the mound deposit. Use annotation for additional types

Mound_shape.desc: Select the closest mound shape, and use annotations for supplementary detail

Mound_surface_vegetation.desc: Describe mound surface vegetation, particularly if distinct ecosystem is associated with the mound that is different to that of the local dominant vegetation. If so, please take at least one device photo of mound surface vegetation

Stone_artefact_count.desc: Record a tally of stone artefacts observed on the mound surface. Use the certainty slider for estimates on large assemblages

Historical_artefact_count.desc: Record a tally of historic artefacts observed on the mound surface. Use the certainty slider for estimates on large assemblages

In_situ_hearth_count.desc: Record a tally of all in situ hearths observed on the mound surface. Use the certainty slider for estimates on larger assemblages

Heating_element_scatters.desc: Is there evidence of disturbed or remnant hearths as indicated by scatters of heating elements within the feature boundary?

Heating_element_types_observed.desc: Select all heating element types observed

Additional_notes.desc: Describe any other significant features or provide additional details here

Paper_notes_and_sketches.desc: Photograph or otherwise upload any hard copy notes, sketches or plans associated with this feature. Ensure north arrow, approximate scale and a key are included. Use annotation for additional comments.

External_camera_ID.desc: Select other cameras used for photography (if applicable)

External_camera_file_names_and_attachmen.desc: Provide file names and brief captions for images taken with external camera, if applicable.

External_camera_image_attachment.desc: Upload files on server, and annotate those files with captions.

Survey_instrument_data.desc: If recording coincides with instrument survey, please detail job name logged to instrument and associated point IDs or range of IDs associated with this feature.

Dominant_vegetation_cover.desc: Vegetation cover, 30 m observational unit, uppermost vegetation stratum only

Additional_environmental_notes.desc: Additional notes about landscape, vegetation, geomorphology of significance and not already captured

Morphology_type.desc: Consider the geomorphological context of the site and select most appropriate response. Use notes below for additional description or if unsure

Morphology_notes.desc: Record any additional notes about site morphology not captured elsewhere

Shelter_type.desc: Select the most appropriate shelter type

Orientation.desc: Record the compass bearing through the middle of the shelter area and away from the shelter entrance. This should represent the central orientation of the shelter, i.e. perpendicular to the shelter entrance or rear wall, as appropriate.

Floor_length_m.desc: Maximum length of floor measured to inner-most dripline (metres)

Floor_width_m.desc: Maximum width of floor measured to inner-most dripline (metres)

Floor_component_1_type.desc: Choose the main floor deposit type

Floor_component_1_percent.desc: Estimate the percentage of the whole floor surface area for the main floor type

Floor_component_2_type.desc: Describe the secondary floor deposit type

Floor_component_2_percent.desc: Estimate the percentage of the whole floor surface area for the secondary floor type

Stone_artefact_count.desc: Record a tally of stone artefacts observed on the mound surface. Use the certainty slider for estimates on large assemblages

Historical_artefact_count.desc: Record a tally of historic artefacts observed on the mound surface. Use the certainty slider for estimates on large assemblages

In_situ_hearth_count.desc: Record a tally of all in situ hearths observed on the mound surface. Use the certainty slider for estimates on larger assemblages

Heating_element_scatters.desc: Is there evidence of disturbed or remnant hearths as indicated by scatters of heating elements within the feature boundary?

Heating_element_types_observed.desc: Select all heating element types observed

Art_panel_count.desc: Count of individual art panels present at the site. Panels are discrete assemblages of motifs bounded by natural rock features (e.g. fissures) or weathering. For complex sites, please draw sketchplan and photograph, or store an annotated photograph here.

Subsurface_potential.desc: Assess the potential for sub-surface deposits of cultural material.

Morphology_notes.desc: Record any additional notes about site morphology not captured elsewhere

Place_name.desc: List any names associated with this feature (historic, language or contemporary), if applicable

Length_m.desc: Record the maximum length of this feature

Width_m.desc: Record the maximum width of this feature

Height_m.desc: If applicable, record the maximum height of this feature. Leave blank if not applicable

General_type.desc:
Select the general feature type. For phase 1 recording of complex features with multiple attributes, use the 'site' designation.
Note: Values and info are adapted from: California Office of Historic Preservation (1995) Instructions for recording historic resources. Department of the Interior, Sacramento, CA. (Accessed 5 April 2019 at http://scic.org/docs/OHP/manual95.pdf)

Historical_activities.desc: What activity types appear to be associated with this feature

Historical_activities_description.desc: Provide a narrative description of activities that appear to have been conducted at this site or feature.

Subsurface_potential.desc: Assess the potential for sub-surface deposits of cultural material.

Archaeological_description.desc: Provide a narrative description of the physical layout of the site or feature, as well as formation processes and potential for sub-surface deposits

Age_estimate.desc: Make a preliminary assessment of minimum and maximum site age, noting supporting evidence

Additional_notes.desc: Describe any other significant features or provide additional details here

Paper_notes_and_sketches.desc: Photograph or otherwise upload any hard copy notes, sketches or plans associated with this feature. Ensure north arrow, approximate scale and a key are included. Use annotation for additional comments.

Morphology_notes.desc: Record any additional notes about site morphology not captured elsewhere

Cultural_associations.desc: Select cultural associations for this feature

Maximum_age.desc: What is the age of the oldest burial?

Minimum_age.desc: What is the age of the youngest burial

Age_range--specific.desc: Note both minimum and maximum ages, where known.

Burial_form.desc: What is the form of the burial?

Burial_number.desc: A count of individual burials observed

Grave_markers_used.desc: Select all grave marker types associated with this feature

Preservation.desc: Select all preservation conditions that apply to this feature

Orientation.desc: What is the orientation (degrees, measuring from feet to head) of burials? For multiple burials, record average orientation and provide additional notes or sketches to illustrate

Artefacts.desc: What, if any, artefacts or other cultural materials are associated with this burial

Additional_notes.desc: Additional notes about the feature or associated artefacts not recorded elsewhere.

Detailed_description.desc: Provide a detailed description of this POI and any associated data

Information_source.desc: Record the source of the information, such as names of individuals, historical sources, and so on

Additional_notes.desc: Additional notes about the feature or associated artefacts not recorded elsewhere.

Dominant_vegetation_type.desc: 30m observational unit, uppermost vegetation stratum only

Dominant_vegetation_cover.desc: Vegetation cover, 30 m observational unit, uppermost vegetation stratum only

Additional_environmental_notes.desc: Additional notes about landscape, vegetation, geomorphology of significance and not already captured

Tree_type.desc: Select the most appropriate tree type

Girth_mm.desc: Girth should be measured at 'chest height' i.e. 1.3 m above ground, in milimeters.

Tree_Height.desc: Choose the most appropriate size range for this tree. Select 'indeterminate' for all felled trees or those that have lost upper limbs

Condition.desc: Assess the condition of the tree. For living trees, consider issues such as the number of dead or missing limbs, and areas of damage

Number_of_scars.desc: List the total number of scars recorded for this tree

Stump_height_mm.desc: Measure the height, in millimetres, of any stumps associated with this tree

Additional_notes.desc: Additional notes about the feature or associated artefacts not recorded elsewhere.

Paper_notes_and_sketches.desc: Photograph or otherwise upload any hard copy notes, sketches or plans associated with this feature. Ensure north arrow, approximate scale and a key are included. Use annotation for additional comments.

External_camera_ID.desc: Select other cameras used for photography (if applicable)

External_camera_file_names_and_attachmen.desc: Provide file names and brief captions for images taken with external camera, if applicable.

External_camera_image_attachment.desc: Upload files on server, and annotate those files with captions.

Survey_instrument_name.desc: If recording coincides with instrument survey, please select appropriate instrument name.

Survey_instrument_data.desc: If recording coincides with instrument survey, please detail job name logged to instrument and associated point IDs or range of IDs associated with this feature.

Scar_Height_Above_Ground_mm.desc: Measure from the ground surface to the bottom of the scar, if applicable. Please note that the scar base is the lowermost area of axe damage, rather than the scar dry face

Scar_length_mm.desc: Measure the maximum length of scar, i.e., between the upper- and lower-most cut marks observed

Scar_width_mm.desc: Measure the maximum width of scar, i.e., between the widest lateral cut marks observed

Aperture_length_mm.desc: Only applicable on scars featuring an aperture into the tree hollow, for example, sugarbag scars. Measure the maximum length of the actual aperture.

Aperture_width_mm.desc: Only applicable on scars featuring an aperture into the tree hollow, for example, sugarbag scars. Measure the maximum width of the actual aperture.

Device_photos_of_scar.desc: Please take one or more overview shots, and if relevant, additional detailed shots of prominent features. If using a DSLR, enter relevant details below and ensure these are uploaded at days end.

Additional_notes.desc: Additional notes about the feature or associated artefacts not recorded elsewhere.

Scar.External_camera_ID_scars: External camera ID (scars) Select other cameras used for photography (if applicable)

External_camera_file_names_and_attachmen.desc: Provide file names and brief captions for images taken with external camera, if applicable.

External_camera_image_attachment.desc: Upload files on server, and annotate those files with captions.

Device_photos.desc: Please take one or more overview shots, and if relevant, additional detailed shots of prominent features. If using a DSLR, enter relevant details below and ensure these are uploaded at days end.

Raw_material_colour.desc: Provide a classification of the primary colour and secondary colour (e.g. Reddish-brown), or if available, provide the Munsell rock colour designation

Feature_details.Weight_g: Weight (g) If available, record artefact weight (e.g. for lab-based analysis)

Flake_completeness.desc: Assess the degree of flake fragmentation

Platform_surface.desc: Select the type of platform present

Platform_angle.desc: Measure the angle between the platform and dorsal surface. Ideally, this should be recorded with a goniometer

Platform_width_mm.desc: Maximum width across the platform surface, and between the two lateral margins. Leave blank if either lateral margin is absent

Platform_thickness_mm.desc: Maximum thickness of the platform, between the ventral and dorsal surface, and measured through the umbo and in line with the percussion axis . Leave blank if platform margin is only partially present (e.g. a crushed platform)

Maximum_length_mm.desc: Length of percussion axis, or the length from the point of percussion to the most distal point. This becomes the maximum length on broken flakes where the platform or termination are absent

Maximum_width_mm.desc: Maximum width, measured across the longest line that can be drawn at right angles to the percussion axis

Maximum_thickness_mm.desc: Maximum thickness of flake, measured on and through the percussion axis

Termination_type.desc: The shape of the distal end of the flake or distal fragment

Overhang_removal.desc: Indicate whether there is evidence of overhang removal, typically indicated by the scars on the dorsal surface of the flake that were created before it was detached, through platform preparation

Dorsal_cortex_type.desc: A general description of the texture of the cortex

Dorsal_cortex_amount.desc: Ordinal measurement of the amount of cortext remaining on the dorsal surface

Dorsal_scar_count.desc: Count of negative flake scars on dorsal surface, including both complete and partial scars

Dorsal_scar_direction.desc: Record the initiation quadrant for dorsal scars. For example, a flake with dorsal scars initatied in Q1 and Q2 only would be recorded as 1,2

Dorsal_flake_scar_maximum_length.desc: Maximum length of the longest flake scar preserved on the dorsal surface

Additional_notes.desc: Additional notes about the feature or associated artefacts not recorded elsewhere.

External_camera_ID.desc: Select other cameras used for photography (if applicable)

External_camera_file_names_and_attachmen.desc: Provide file names and brief captions for images taken with external camera, if applicable.

External_camera_image_attachment.desc: Upload files on server, and annotate those files with captions.

Survey_instrument_name.desc: If recording coincides with instrument survey, please select appropriate instrument name.

Survey_instrument_data.desc: If recording coincides with instrument survey, please detail job name logged to instrument and associated point IDs or range of IDs associated with this feature.

Device_photos.desc: Please take one or more overview shots, and if relevant, additional detailed shots of prominent features. If using a DSLR, enter relevant details below and ensure these are uploaded at days end.

Raw_material_colour.desc: Provide a classification of the primary colour and secondary colour (e.g. Reddish-brown), or if available, provide the Munsell rock colour designation

Completeness.desc: Estimate the proportion of the original artefact present

Weight_g.desc: If available, record artefact weight (e.g. for lab-based analysis)

Length_mm.desc: Maximum length of the artefact when oriented correctly

Width_mm.desc: Maximum width of the artefact when oriented correctly

Thickness_mm.desc: Maximum thickness of the artefact when oriented correctly

Largest_scar_length_mm.desc: Cores only. Oriented length of the longest flake scar evident on a core, if complete.

Core_largest_scar_shape.desc: Select the shape of the largest flake scar present

Core_platform_count.desc: A simple count of the no. of platforms from which flakes were struck

Core_platform_1_surface.desc: Select the type of platform present

Core_platform_1_length_mm.desc: Maximum width across the platform surface, and between the two lateral margins either side of the main flake scar. Leave blank if either lateral margin is absent (e.g. broken core)

Core_platform_1_width_mm.desc: Maximum thickness of the platform, between the ventral and dorsal surface, and measured through the umbo and in line with the percussion axis

Core_platform_1_angle_mm.desc: The angle between the platform surface and the surface of the core from which flakes were struck. Requires a goniometer.

Core_platform_2_surface.desc: Select the type of platform present

Core_platform_2_length_mm.desc: Maximum width across the platform surface, and between the two lateral margins either side of the main flake scar. Leave blank if either lateral margin is absent (e.g. broken core)

Core_platform_2_width_mm.desc: Maximum thickness of the platform, between the ventral and dorsal surface, and measured through the umbo and in line with the percussion axis

Core_platform_2_angle.desc: The angle between the platform surface and the surface of the core from which flakes were struck. Requires a goniometer.

Core_classification.desc: If known, select the appropriate core type

Remaining_cortical_surface.desc: Estimate the proportion of cortical surface remaining on the artefact

Usewear.desc: Record any evidence of impact damage observed on the artefact

Additional_notes.desc: Additional notes about the feature or associated artefacts not recorded elsewhere.

External_camera_ID.desc: Select other cameras used for photography (if applicable)

External_camera_file_names_and_attachmen.desc: Provide file names and brief captions for images taken with external camera, if applicable.

External_camera_image_attachment.desc: Upload files on server, and annotate those files with captions.

Survey_instrument_name.desc: If recording coincides with instrument survey, please select appropriate instrument name.

Survey_instrument_data.desc: If recording coincides with instrument survey, please detail job name logged to instrument and associated point IDs or range of IDs associated with this feature.

Device_photos.desc: Please take one or more overview shots, and if relevant, additional detailed shots of prominent features. If using a DSLR, enter relevant details below and ensure these are uploaded at days end.

Diagnostic.desc: Diagnostic artefacts are those that unambiguously indicative of a single original vessel (e.g. finish, base)

Grouped_fragments.desc: Where multiple fragments resulting from breakage of the same bottle or bottle fragment are found at one location, record as a group

Grouped_fragment_weight_g.desc: Record collective weight of all fragments if working in lab situation, or otherwise leave blank

Group_max_fragment_length_mm.desc: Measure the maximum length of the largest fragment

Group_notes.desc: Record any additional notes relating to the grouped fragments

Fragment_location.desc: Record fragment location for artefact being catalogued

Body_shape.desc: For body sherds only, record horizontal shape

Patination_present.desc: Presence of white-coloured patina across sherd due exposure

Base_diameter_mm.desc: Total diameter of the base, if present

Pontil_mark_present.desc: Small, usually circular depression on bottle base

Kickup_depth_mm.desc: Depth of kickup on base, measured from base near centre

Trademark.desc: Transcribe or photograph trademarks, noting location and details here

Marks_motifs_and_decoration.desc: Transcribe any text, motifs or decoration and, if possible, photograph above

Additional_notes.desc: Additional notes about the feature or associated artefacts not recorded elsewhere.

External_camera_ID.desc: Select other cameras used for photography (if applicable)

External_camera_filenames.desc: Provide file names and brief captions in annotations, and upload files on server

Survey_instrument_data.desc: If recording coincides with instrument survey, please detail job name logged to instrument and associated point IDs or range of IDs associated with this feature.

Device_photos.desc: Please take one or more overview shots, and if relevant, additional detailed shots of prominent features. If using a DSLR, enter relevant details below and ensure these are uploaded at days end.

Diagnostic.desc: Diagnostic artefacts are those that unambiguously indicative of a single original vessel (e.g. base)

Paste_colour.desc: Colour of paste to create ceramic

Decorative_methods.desc: Select all decorative methods that apply

Visible_motifs.desc: Describe motifs applied (e.g. hairline around rim, coloured and scalloped rim). Please ensure photos include motifs

Decorative_pattern_name.desc: If known, select the decorative pattern used

Additional_notes.desc: Additional notes about the feature or associated artefacts not recorded elsewhere.

External_camera_filenames.desc: Provide file names and brief captions in annotations, and upload files on server

Device_photos.desc: Please take one or more overview shots, and if relevant, additional detailed shots of prominent features. If using a DSLR, enter relevant details below and ensure these are uploaded at days end.

Material.desc: What is the artefact manufactured from

Type.desc: What type of artefact is this, considering both its form and function

Additional_notes.desc: Additional notes about the feature or associated artefacts not recorded elsewhere.

Hearth_type.desc: What type of hearth feature is this

Heating_element_types.desc: What type of heating elements, if any, have been used

Heating_element_frequency.desc: Frequency of heating elements on the hearth feature

Materials_present.desc: Select all materials observed on the hearth
